WRITING.TEXT: I have never been that into the single player of Call of Duty, but I did play through Advanced Warfare's campaign and it was pretty fun. I hear Ininite Warfare has a good story, and I hear Black Ops 3 storyline is really crazy. You should be fine playing any of them, and if you have an Xbox One you can play 2,3, World at War, Black Ops, and Black ops 2.

I might be one of the few people who actually likes the future games better than the BOOTS ON THE GROUND gameplay. People kept on saying how every call of duty played to similarly to eachother and the second they changed it up, people hated it.
In Snyder's name, AMEN.

WRITING.TITLE: Saitama vs. Superman, Iron Man, Batman, and Captain America
WRITING.TEXT:
Round 1: In character
Round 2: Bloodlusted
Location: Uninhabited planet the size of earth.
Inspired by [this](https://np.reddit.com/r/OnePunchMan/comments/63tdeo/disaster_level_saitama_by_woo_chul_lee/?sort=top) post.
Vs. debates don't take into account authorial intent, otherwise protagonists wouldn't lose to villains.
Why do you think he wins simply because he is a joke? Why does that override feats?
That is a no limits fallacy.

I am sort of the inverse. Being a fan of Superman, it made me upset that Batman steals the show after he already had the Dark Knight Trilogy. The fact that Batman has to clearly win the fight with Superman because of Batman's extreme popularity. Even though I am not a fan of Batman, I didn't like how he became a killer either.
Also with losing Hans Zimmer I have lost more faith in the movie. Junkie XL might do a fine job, but I thought Hans Zimmer was one of DC's biggest strenghts.
To each his own. I only kinda liked 300 and Man of Steel, but I hated Batman V Superman and thought the Justice League trailer wasn't up to snuff with trailers for his other movies.
